revised_title: Chemical Reactions of Opium Alkaloids and Hydriodic Acid
tldr: The authors conducted experiments with codeia, an opium alkaloid, and hydriodic acid to study their chemical reactions. They discovered that when codeia is heated with hydriodic acid and phosphorus, it produces methyl iodide. The authors also found that the reaction between codeia and hydriodic acid can form different compounds depending on the temperature and conditions. These findings contribute to the understanding of the chemistry of opium alkaloids and their potential applications.
